intro: Pavetta durbanensis, commonly known as Durban pavetta, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub, reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and glossy, while its flowers are small, white or pale pink, and clustered in umbels. Pavetta durbanensis is often found in moist, shaded areas such as forest undergrowth and along stream banks.
